Sprint 1.goal: Set up the necessary environment and tools for developing the Pacman game.

tasks.task_description: Install Python, create a virtual environment and activate it.
Install the Pygame library using pip in the virtual environment.
Initialize a Git repository and add a README file to the project.

Sprint 2.goal: Create the fundamental structure of the Pacman game.

tasks.task_description: Set up an infinite loop that keeps the game running and checks for events.
Define the dimensions of the game window (e.g., 800x600).
Implement functionality to handle keyboard input for Pacman's movement.

Sprint 3.goal: Develop the main game components for Pacman, including characters and the game environment.

tasks.task_description: Draw the representation of Pacman and implement its movement.
Draw ghost characters and implement their movement logic.
Generate the game environment layout, including walls and pathways.

Sprint 4.goal: Incorporate the game logic needed for gameplay mechanics.

tasks.task_description: Define how Pacman and ghosts will move in the game.
tasks.task_name: Implement movement logic for Pacman and ghosts

tasks.task_description: Implement collision detection for walls and for interactions with ghosts.
Add functionality for collecting pellets and updating the score.

Sprint 5.goal: Implement the various game states and functionalities, such as game over, start, and levels.

tasks.task_description: Create conditions that determine when the game is over and display a game over screen.
Implement a method to start the game and restart it after a game over.
Introduce multiple levels and make it progressively harder.

Sprint 6.goal: Refine the game and create full documentation for the project.

tasks.task_description: Enhance the visual and audio aspects of the game for a better user experience.
Review and improve the code efficiency and performance.
Document the game design, code structure, and how to run the game.
